verbatim_example: I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. It's been just over a week without bupe.
I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. ... It's been just over a week without bupe.
Having been at *least* a week since last taking a problem free dump,
After 15 years I'm having to learn a totally new skill!
I'll be a year clean. I never imagined I'd get here... this time it's finally taken hold.

I quit everything about a year and a half ago with the help of a detox place. I relapsed by starting to use Kratom and then ventured into RC benzos as a way to get off Kratom, but of course that spiraled into abusing both and graduating to harder opiates as well as filling my adderall script.

I quit opiates/benzos/adderall 12 days ago, now I am trying to stabilize on Kratom. For the past 4-6 weeks I was trying to go about 4-5 days before using again, but wasn't really lowering my doseages.

The last time I took DHC or Xanax was the Sunday of Labor Day. ... On day 9 I felt some relief, I thought I made it through the worst, however by the Thursday evening of the 2nd week I could feel the benzo withdrawals getting harder and harder to predict, they definitely peaked at the end of week 2.
I've been 4 months sober, I'm doing better now with my cravings... This is the first time in my life I feel like I'm making real connections with people.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering.
haven't had any opis in months
I am in the thick of wd. (withdrawal) - This language is in the present tense, indicating that the user is currently experiencing withdrawal symptoms.
The oxy and benzos ruled my every waking moment. ... The wrestless legs still won't quit.
Now that I am clean, I can barely get out of bed bc back and knees are so bad.
Still having restless legs, but my regular Dr says they're not related, which means that the only withdrawal symptom I had was insomnia...
I am happy to be here, sober .
She tells me she still uses. She asks me if I want to shoot up with her.
By the grace of God, I didn't use.
Six months ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something.
Six months and some change ago I couldn't even go 60 minutes without having to use something to change the way I feel. This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years.
I used to run one in r/opiates

I was in a hospital bed, could barely walk and breathe, was doing the “undercover ninja” every night to try and get comfortable to sleep, and had no direction or positive things in my life. ... But I’m able to deal and cope with it without loading up a shot of heroin
a year ago I was in a hospital bed with a Staff Infection and Pneumonia; I was making plans to go pick up the second I got out...
I’m officially one year clean from opiates.
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse. Came clean to everyone I know (all very supportive) Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday.
One week down, working on day 8.
Eight days down, moving into day 9. ... Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.

I'm wrapping up day 11 in a few hours... I still cry like a baby sometimes but less frequently. ...I didn't 'feel like' becoming an addict either... Now I'm focusing my effort on healing instead of harm, strength instead of weakness, mindfulness instead of numbness...
Weird - I don't want to use BAD here because things are improving from all angles, ... Still can't totally relax without some restless feet.
about to head to the gym in hopes of pumping some natural feel good into my body.

This past weekend was better than the last... Nothing crazy, I still didn't feel amazing or super peppy but I was able to function and get around to do shit. ... Hopefully time starts to speed up a bit more.
Today I feel... decent? It feels like my body is trying to act normal and my brain is just a few steps behind.

I can say that I have never had a craving in the 17 days up until that point. It hit me like a fuckin sack of bricks... started pouring sweat, plotting and rationalizing all the ways I could get around this security blanket that I've created...
Yesterday went pretty well other than a few cases of the clammy sweats... Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go.
Yesterday was okay minus a crazy afternoon episode of the sweats. Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Yesterday sucked but it's all good. Another day down
I've gone this long. I feel so much better than I thought I would.
I've now gone five days without
I have been off heroin for six days now, but last night and this morning i had an incredibly bad toothache. ... My dad gave me a 7.5 hydrocodone.
Day 3. At work early. Feel OK.
I haven't thought that in a long time even when I made it to three days before.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
It's been a month and a half. (past tense) ... Stick with it. I was hopeless. If I can do it, you can. (refers to past experience of being in a hopeless state)
I take opiates everyday now, normally oxycodone with hydrocodone
I don't WD often because I keep like 80 pounds of poppy seeds under my bed. But when I do WD, I WD badly because of my tolerance.
I've tried to quit 5 times in the last year or so. Start a program, leave the program. Get through detox, feel great and then "just for the weekend" myself back into active addiction.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. The days where I feel out of control and anxious are farther and farther apart.
I've got 4 months clean and sober - the idea of being in pain just riles me up. I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
I've dedicated myself to being a "strong, independent woman" who can overcome anything once I put my mind to it. I kicked a 4 year IV meth habit... This opiate habit struck me like a cancer.
That phenomenon of craving is so fucking real, and there has never been any doubt that I'm a true-blue addict regarding these pills. I have nearly 6 months sober...

The memory fades as time goes by. I doubt the memories will ever disappear completely, but I liken it to the memories of an ex-girlfriend. They are romantic memories, and when we think about them, we always conveniently fail to also remember the horrible things that we hated about the relationship.

I remember when I was using... Well consider this: there is no better time than now, because it always is ‘now’. If you put it off until tomorrow, it will still be ‘now’, just tomorrow! And today will be gone. ...put it (and leave it) in the past where it belongs.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication (which the doctors often failed to warn about), the doc suddenly ends the script.
I was in recovery, and actually a year or so into it at that point. I’ll never forget it- constant memories of using and wanting to use.
Clean for over two years... (past tense) ...Why am I still searching this shit. (present tense, but in the context of past recovery)
I've been clean for two years, and my drug of choice is and always will be heroin. I haven't tried to get any dope, or even any painkillers.
The worst thing about a craving is that when I get one, it's not for a fuckin vicodin or two, but a needle and a bundle of downs. Ugh. Clenching my teeth lately.
I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately...
I haven't shot dope in two years... .
I haven't touched an opiate in over two years, haven't shot up in almost three... (This text is in the past tense and indicates that the user has been in a state of recovery)
So I am about 90-100 days clean. It’s the most clean time I’ve had and I seriously couldn’t be happier.
I woke up this morning with a call from my sponsors girlfriend - he passed away today. Young dude, had so much going for him, 3 years clean and used once and now he’s gone.
I’m over 1 year into sobriety... Today was a little brutal I was almost shivering and it was like 55 degrees...

I have a lot of 10/325 norcos. Instead of going through tedious CWE, I had an idea to crush pills to powder, mix with cold water and suck solution through cotton with oral syringe as one would if prepping an IV shot.
So I sniffed my first bag after 3 months of being clean... .

I could have used all that money for clothes, food, and new kicks. I could have spent it on my girlfriend who cried in my arms when she found out about my lifestyle and begged me to stop. Well, I'm finally listening.
I've been sober for 13 months this coming Friday... When I got clean, I didn't think my last shot of heroin would be the last one for the rest of my life.
The 17th was the last time I had a shot of heroin. It’s been a loooong year and a half but I’m damn proud of myself.
Today is day 17 without heroin. Its been a struggle im still struggling with the mental sides of things and the depression but im ok i guess
Today i am 15 days off heroin.
Today i am at day 20 heroin and alcohol free.

Today is the start of day 21, indicating that the user has already started their withdrawal process and is now in a state of recovery. The mention of 'day 21' suggests that the user has been through withdrawal symptoms for at least three weeks.
Today is 34 days without heroin and alcohol, Day 34 Heroin free
Im day 39 heroin and alcohol free.
Today i am on day 50 heroin and alcohol free. I have never made it this far before with heroin and alcohol.
Im on day two without heroin. I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting.
I am day 10 off heroin... been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals.
I am on day 15 off heroin.
I have been in rehab for the passed 3 months. I am two days out and i am living in a house with other clean and sober ppl.
I used every day for about a month. I was stealing and pawning my mom's jewelry to get money for dope.
With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals.
I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.
My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
100+ days later and I've been to at least one meeting pretty much every day. I'm pretty confident I'd be using if it wasn't for NA.
I have four months clean today. These four months have been the hardest I've ever worked in my entire life.
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years! (past tense) My state label is 'recovery'.
This was the last time I hope I would ever use heroin.

Today I've got 90 days. 90 days ago I was sitting in the IOP program at the Betty Ford Center stung out of my mind with twenty dollars in my pocket anxiously waiting for it to be over that day so that my friend and I could go score yet again.
Hooked it up! 4 buns of fire ass "dreamchasers" dope with a eighth of some sticky icky for $90!!! Also got a 4 of some syrup that I saved..gonna be in nodsville alllll day tomorrow.
It's sad to think...But Damn! Kinda a reality check and motivation to quit..
Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.
So today I have 252 days clean (8 months 8 days). My alternative sentence is 7 years w/ an 85% in state prison. So its safe to say I take my recovery very seriously.
I've decided to quit opiates starting tomorrow after eight months of use... Hopefully I'll be able to keep this up...
For all of you who've decided to as of tomorrow, good for you... I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
I was doing so well, was already through the worst of the WDs. I have no willpower, I only hope that come tomorrow I'll be able to continue with my plan for sobriety in the new year.
I won't have access to any more for at least a week. I'm forcing myself to detox from a pretty large opiate habit...
I quit dope about a month ago
I was heavily addicted to heroin last year but have been clean since June 14. ... yesterday I was feeling extremely depressed, sweating, cold, jittery/RLS, classic mild WDs.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
I’ve been clean off of all drugs for 39 days.
It's been nearly two years since I stopped injecting oxy, oxymorphone, hydromorphone, morphine, and anything else really.
Disclaimer I do not abuse this my health insurance fucked me and can no longer see my psychiatrist so I took matters in my own hands.
After my shitty hospital visit I got good news!
As of October 12th I was officially two years sober
This is what I did before I sold my studio for opiates 3 years ago.
I've gotten to know the plant inside and out over the past year and I'd like to spread the goodness with anyone who's trying to get clean or struggling to stay clean.

Tomorrow marks 1 week since my last 2lb dose of PST. Symptoms have been managed with Lope for the first 2 days, and then nothing stronger than an ill advised couple Benadryl on day 3, and a few advil.
11 days since I quit a daily PST habit of 2 1/2 pounds a day for about 2 years.
I'm currently 15 days clean off PST and used Lope taper to quit.
I've got about 3 weeks clean off a 2 year PST habit of about 2 lbs a day.
I've lived with depression since I was about 19 and have been on and off diff ssris and anti deppresents, and felt I had enough clean time to get a baseline intake done.
12 year off and on opiate user with ~3 years as longest clean time, coming of my longest everyday using time of 2+ years (starting 300g poppy seeds/day, going to 2.5lbs seeds/day)
I've got about 6 months clean from an on/off whenever I could get it(percs>oxys>heroin>oxys>poppy seeds>heroin>oxy you get it) habit over last 12 years.
End of day seven, goddamn bastard 14-hour workday is done. Bye-bye Egghead U, I'm going the hell home to a bath (my back!) and some sleep.
It's the kind of day I used to deal with by taking a handful of pills, so things wouldn't bug me so much.
When I kicked opiates I also kicked caffeine, and I haven't had a drink in a long time. And I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
My body is like an old, tired sock... I keep wanting to stretch out, shake and use my muscles a bit.
I have been clean for two weeks now. No opiates. No drinking. No caffeine.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
Four weeks. (past tense) I am clean, I am alive, I am beginning to feel comfortable in my skin. (state label is 'withdrawal')
Six weeks was miles in the future, never thought I'd get here. Here I am. ... Six weeks clean, feels like kind of a big deal!
I have been out with family and friends, walked in nature, went to a concert, held hands with my love, played with my kid, did my taxes, did some exercises. I am still weak, it's a long road back.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track. Getting off the shit was hell.
I'm fine. Every day is just a day now. I don't wake up in agony, thinking about a fix constantly. I just... live.

The video title suggests that the user is in a state of recovery, and there is no mention of current or future opiate use. The phrase 'Everything We Think We Know About Addiction Is Wrong' implies a past understanding or experience with addiction.
I have two years sober today... I used to tell myself that I have done the damage to my brain and I can never truly be happy.
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked.
I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety. ... My son was born about 9 months into my sobriety...
I am 8 months sober from a heavy heroin habit. My family still see me as the piece of shit I use to be...
I have been clean for 12 days other than 4 days ago I got a bag. Knowing as soon as I get some money I am going to be tempted to pick up again.
I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months.
I haven't used in around 3 weeks and it only appeared around the time the h would have been leaving my system so I'm not sure if there's any correlation.
we've recently been trying to quit, I've been having a much easier time than her (basically through my wds and hardly craving)
My friend od’d on methadone last summer, just got arrested for possession half a year after the fact because I was too busy giving cpr to hide my bottle.
I kicked my h habit about 3 weeks ago and haven’t had the urge to use more than every now and then since
Pretty insecure about it cause I only really make joke music. Being serious scares the christ outta me... (past tense) ...when I was using (past tense)
it's about my mindset when I was using
I have been at the house for the 5th day now. But another day sober.

I remember myself before using and I was fun, outgoing, worked my ass off and people enjoyed being around me. ... Now I have ran out of road and am now in the midst of finding a new path, one without all the obstacles.
Still NO SLEEP!!!! (past tense of experiencing sleep deprivation due to opiate withdrawal), Still NO SLEEP!!!! is a symptom of withdrawal, and the state label is 'withdrawal'.
I can tell the difference. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me.
Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier.
Didn't get to spend much time with her, but the joy I saw on her face when I wished her a happy birthday before anything else and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
Over a period of six months I went from 14mg-2mg. Until without my doctor's supervision or knowledge decided I had enough of the shackled and jumped off the subs at 2mg.

Tried to cold turkey approx 8mg sub last year went a month clean and I just couldn't bear it anymore. Took the subs for 7 days, still felt a bit strange during that time. Probably the kratom withdrawal under the subs.
Now I am one of those people, and you the reader with a bit of grit and hard work will be too.
it's been about 4 months off opiates and I have done it without any real support system besides my girlfriend and family.
I ran out of my meds soon after I got out and am continuing to heal up, find a job and change my life around. It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober.
I never get withdrawals; I used to but got past the worst of my addiction and now I only use two times a week give or take a day.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals...
I just got out of my 2nd stint in rehab today and my mother is sooo supportive. I am now 23 and feel like I need to get it right this time; I know I do not want to pick up.
I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean...
So I have been clean now from heroin, well from everything including cigarettes for 40 days. ... Working out and meditating has saved me from wanting to ever use again
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.
I remember endless aching Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking anything to stop the shaking,
I was thinking yesterday listening to this podcast about a life story from a former addict who actually turned their life around and now has a masters degree, a family, etc, and is doing great.

stick the needle in my arm, constant hell, im left alone, burned my bridges, now i'm home, in the dark, dwell my soul, i am lifeless, i am cold, i was but a dying rose, spoiled, rotton, and decomposed
On to rehab, it was my second one. The first one I planned on using as soon as I got out and I did. This one I wanted to but at the same time, I can't do this to my mother anymore.
This withdrawal thing didn’t work so good in the past,

So I went home to my parents and told them everything and tomorrow I am off to rehab. (past tense withdrawal) I have done everything to get clean the last 6 months, (past tense withdrawal) but after a few years of shootn dope every day, I am too deep in to make it to the other side by myself. (state label is 'use' and now transitioning to 'recovery')
I survived day 1 (today) easy, I have no idea why I tried to do it myself 50 times when I should have come here right away. They make the W 80% better...

I still have running lava from my ass and only sleep five hours a night. I even have feelings for someone (like a genuine friendship with someone that never done drugs) and that is sooo amazing makes me feel alive n stuff + proves that I can befriend normal people and not be judged by my past
I am clean now. Five days ago I did two shots of heroin... How is that even possible?
I made a post about taking a small shot in the middle of my wd, and I am soo glad I did cuz yea I had to start the wd all over but it is like 1/3 painfull so I am actually enjoying myself.
Being clean is hard but if I keep it up mabye some day I won’t have to keep fighting the urge to use or to kill myself.
I had my wisdom teeth pulled and was given 12 5mg percs (total burn :/) but I smoked and developed dry sockets.
On day 7!!!!!, in the next 12 hours or so I will oficially have a week clean. The only WD symtoms I am still having is the sleep...

I am on day 7 of quitting cold turkey. This is not my first rodeo with recovery though, but my first time getting clean without rehab... I always end up relapsing around the 9 month mark, happened twice already.
Just hit day 8 of quitting so I have been officially clean for a week now.
I'm finally over the physical withdraws, which is great.
I'm close to the end of day 12 of being sober and I am extremely stressed about going to work. I'm shaking as I'm writing this.
I just came off a 5 month run a month ago. Made it through withdraws and had 15 days completely sober.
I’ve been clean for 2 weeks and relapsed last night by snorting two stamp bags of heroin (ecp). I’ve been done the physical withdraws for like a week now,
My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. Im 24 hours in right now and feel quite terrible.
Once you got clean, how long did it take to feel like your was brain was pumping out them juices again?
I’m clean now with 25 days sober
Anyone on here right now that is sober or looking to get sober

I’m newly clean (got 10 days completely sober), because I used in my car so much I’m still a little worried I could of missed something that got stuck in some crevice or got in somewhere I couldn’t get to. I’d be damned if I got popped for something when I don’t even do drugs anymore.
DONT COP AND DRIVE HIGH AF! (emphasis on not using opiates while driving)
haven't had anything in almost a month
My main question here for my people in recovery is what significant or little changes have you noticed in yourself? For me it's my self image and learning to love myself.
Until one day I just had to leave because I was dope sick
Luckily I've only been using everyday for about 3 weeks, but fuck. I'm 24 hours into withdraw and it's tough. I have to say I don't feel as bad, physically, as I did when coming off oxy.
I started Suboxone today and doing IOP. Group therapy 5 times week, therapy and NA/SMART on top of it.
This is my first sober weekend so I'm staying busy. ... This is my first time taking the total abstinence path, so I felt isolated but met some really cool guys at the meeting and got some numbers.
Today is day 13 for me! This is the longest I've been sober since summer 2011, and first time I'm really sober.
I'm 4 weeks sober, 28 days yeah yeah! I'm clean another day and thankful for that!

I know I can stay sober one more day, and it's my hope you all will too! It was really nice not thinking, "oh I've got dope money!" but rather I'm going to go walk around the mall and get a coffee. ... I celebrated a month sober for the first time.
But, I am clean, and life is good! ... We all can, and will, get our lives back in time.

I'm feeling good today, had a minor drug dream last night so I got up a bit earlier than usual this morning but I didn't let it bring me down like I usually would! Trying to move forward, and have another day sober under my belt.

I've hemmed and hauled about weather or not to go, but after getting advice from my IOP group, NA home group, and therapists; I have decided to go. All my friends know I am in recovery and will not be drinking with them.
It's day 59 for me. Yesterday I had a big surprise; I graduated from IOP! ... So now I have my certificate, and I, feeling pretty good! My continuing care group is awesome!
Weather you have years, months, days, or hours clean
Still do key tags at my Friday night homegroup, and I just started with HNI. Will be bringing meetings into a local detox facility the second Tuesday of every month.
It's day 110 for me since I last used opiates... I've gotten out of little 90 day funk finally!

I finally asked for help, and started being honest. Honest with my family, with my friends, with my therapist, and most importantly with myself. It was the first time that I truly accepted that I was indeed an addict, and that I couldn't do it by myself.
I haven't done opiates in 10 months and I still fantasize about doing dope constantly.  And dream about scoring, or remembering a misplaced gram in my room every night.
Now after quitting H for almost 2 years it's like I've aged 10 years.
I had my last oxy yesterday morning -- then I had about 1mg of sub last night, and I'm 100% dry
I am starting to feel human again. Praise satan!!! (48 hours since last oxy dose)
After 90 hours since my last oxycodone dose, I can officially say that I am withdrawal free (with minor exception).
I've had to call on my clean friends and therapist every single day for the past week. Hanging on for dear life here.
Smoked a roach I had in my ash tray on Friday night and felt immense relief from the nasty cravings I was/am getting for my DOC.
I just hit 96 hours into my current detox. Feeling a little more human.
I'm barely 100 hours into my detox but I'm just thinking about last Wednesday around noon, three hours after my last dose...

I've been to rehab before, last stint was in 2009. It was a very clinical style rehab, I learnt a lot about my addiction intellectually and it all made sense to me. I stayed clean for a year and a half and the roller coaster began again.
I'm an addict in early recovery (Feb. 22), I'm tripping balls.
I have been clean off heroin for 7 years...I was coming off almost a year habit of a ball a day and took those subs 4 of them the first night and 2 for a few days tell they were gone...
Now before everyone freaks out just know I'm a ex homeless junkie who managed to kick a 8 ball a day habit on 9 suboxin. Detox 7 times, impatient numerous times...etc etc.
I've been without heroin for a little bit now, I've had my ups and downs, and it has seemed a lot easier this time around.
I'm 24 and haven't touch heroin/opiates in a year.
Headed into day 4 now of withdrawal from bth. Far from my first rodeo but I'm at the breaking point.
Haven't slept still at all, just absolutely miserable and losing my mind. ...this morning was the worst so far.
Today is day 10, I slept 6 hours STRAIGHT last night, and woke up without the deep bone chills. I was so happy I cried.
I have a little over 18 months clean... who knew I'd get clean and feel the same.
I have been opiate free for a respectable amount of time... I went through a very long period where I only played video games while high...
He kicked with over 120 oxy 30s and over $200 of heroin IN HIS POSSESSION.

So here I am, 60 days clean today.
Just out of curiosity. I feel like getting to a meeting and expanding my support group a little.

These 6 months of recovery have been fucking amazing!! I started at the very bottom at a sales job, and have worked my way close to the top. Just got promoted to sales manager last week! I'm making great money, and will be in the market for my own little condo by summer.
I've been in and out of recovery since '09 and this is the longest I've managed to stay clean.
I've been sticking it out, and great things are happening in my life right now. I'm starting to reap the rewards of all the hard work I've put in...
my W/D's finished and i'm alive!
havent used one of these in about a year.

I got one to help cope with withdrawal and chip off Heroin, because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
Is the dope boy the first guy you call?; Time to call the dope boy
I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once.

I haven't had a dream about using in almost a month, ... My doctor even says that I was stabilized far too high at detox (which is rare from what I hear) and I'm on a taper plan where I drop 2mg per week down to 8 (currently on 10, dropping to 8 tomorrow), and 2mg every 2 weeks after that until I'm down to 2, which I'll probably stay on for a while just as a safety net as I finish getting my life together.

i stopped taking it for a day and a half because i hurt my knee at work, and over the weekend i've probably taken about 80mg-120mg of oxycodone... if i took my last perc 10 at 1am tonight, if i woke up at 10-11am the next day
haven't really dabbled in the dope scene since february

get the once a month "got a patch for you" text a full week early. Patch guy is also a pizza delivery guy! Excited to get the super rare "2 bird one stone" achievement in the opiate world, where it is usually "no birds and you owe me 5 stones."
They say "suspicious activity. Your friend here hopped out of a car and right into yours. Looks like a drug deal to me"
I split the patch into thirds. 1 for her and 2 for me. 1 hour in, no problems,  in fact feeling Awesome!   Then...   next thing I know I'm in a bathtub with all my cloths on getting slapped
im 9 months clean... but damn, i could be having the best day ever and sometimes i just miss partying and getting high.

I was physically addicted and was basically using to not be sick so I could function, go to work, etc, you know how it goes. ... I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc).
Using was fun. This is my weakness.
I've come to terms with my past, I no longer have that shame that comes with realizing that I am indeed an Addict, with a capital A. Using was my coping skill for life's shit.

I have 135 days today... I quit cold turkey and I don't go to NA/AA. This is my first time quitting in my 8 years of using and I haven't relapsed so far.

I have 16 months clean as of Monday... If there's anything in this world that will get between me and my sobriety it's this.
